decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to rapidly deploy aggressive creatures and disrupt the opponent's strategy through hand disruption and removal spells. By utilizing efficient threats such as Thought-Knot Seer and Emperor of Bones, along with powerful disruption tools like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control of the game. The inclusion of cards like Pithing Needle and Nihil Spellbomb further enhances the deck's ability to disrupt opposing strategies, while also making efficient use of lands like Urza's Saga and Eldrazi Temple to generate additional value.

This Modern 1 vs 1 deck revolves around generating a large amount of mana quickly using cards like Pyretic Ritual, Manamorphose, and Desperate Ritual to cast powerful spells such as Past in Flames and Glimpse the Impossible. The goal is to chain together spells and storm off by casting more spells in a single turn, ultimately finishing the opponent off with a storm spell like Grapeshot. Ral, Monsoon Mage and Wrenn's Resolve provide additional card advantage and protection, while Ruby Medallion helps reduce the cost of casting spells, enabling explosive turns.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Guide of Souls to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes powerful spells like Goblin Bombardment and Thraben Charm for additional removal and damage. Arid Mesa, Marsh Flats, and Sacred Foundry provide the necessary mana fixing to cast the deck's spells efficiently. The inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Voice of Victory allows the deck to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also providing additional combat tricks to secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures like Phelia and Ragavan to quickly pressure the opponent while disrupting their game plan with cards like Teferi and Prismatic Ending. Consign to Memory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional value and card advantage, while cards like Solitude and Wrath of the Skies help control the board and deal with threats. The deck aims to apply early pressure, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and close out games quickly before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming opponents with a combination of artifact creatures and powerful artifact cards. It utilizes cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mox Opal to generate mana and recur key cards from the graveyard. Urza's Saga and Weapons Manufacturing serve as powerful enablers that can quickly create threats and generate value. The deck also contains cards like Engineered Explosives and Metallic Rebuke to disrupt opponents' strategies while maintaining its aggressive game plan. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently deploy threats and disrupt opponents to secure a quick victory.

The focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's strategy through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, removal, and card advantage. The deck aims to control the game's tempo by using cards like Thoughtseize and Counterspell to disrupt the opponent's plan while maintaining card advantage with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Quantum Riddler. Additionally, the deck utilizes versatile threats like Murktide Regent and Orcish Bowmasters to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Teferi, Time Raveler, the player can restrict the opponent's options while digging for key pieces. Isochron Scepter provides repeatable access to powerful instants like Orim's Chant and Counterspell. The deck also includes various win conditions such as Solitude and Supreme Verdict to ensure victory once the opponent has been effectively neutralized. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a battle of attrition.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through the efficient use of mana ramp and powerful Eldrazi creatures. By utilizing UrzaTron lands and artifacts like Expedition Map and Mind Stone, the deck aims to quickly ramp up to play high-cost threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Emrakul, the Promised End. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional utility and disruption, while other Eldrazi creatures like Devourer of Destiny and Sire of Seven Deaths provide additional threats and disruptive abilities. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outpace opponents with its powerful creatures and control elements.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy and controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, creature removal, and card advantage. It utilizes a variety of powerful control spells like Counterspell, Thoughtseize, and Force of Negation to dictate the pace of the game, while also gaining card advantage through cards like Cling to Dust and Meticulous Archive. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by efficiently dealing with threats and drawing into more answers, eventually grinding out a win through attrition and careful decision-making.

This deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent with aggressive creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, while disrupting their strategy with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Prismatic Ending. The deck also utilizes cards like Consign to Memory and Solitude for removal and protection. With a mix of aggro and control elements, the deck aims to control the game tempo and overwhelm the opponent before they can fully execute their game plan.

This deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures and ramping up mana quickly to overwhelm opponents. It utilizes control elements such as counterspells and removal spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Emrakul, the Promised End and other powerful Eldrazi creatures are the main win conditions, supported by cards like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck aims to control the board while building towards casting massive threats that can quickly end the game. It also has some graveyard hate and land destruction to deal with opponents' strategies.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure through efficient creatures and removal spells. It utilizes cards like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and Teferi, Time Raveler to disrupt the opponent's strategy, while also using a mix of removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Prismatic Ending to maintain control of the game. The deck also includes cards like Solitude and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to provide both removal and resilience against opposing threats. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's resources and tempo while establishing a board presence to close out the game quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Allosaurus Rider combo by using cards like Eldritch Evolution and Neoform to cheat out big creatures like Griselbrand and Xenagos, God of Revels. It also runs interaction in the form of Pact of Negation and Veil of Summer to protect the combo and disrupt opponents. The deck is able to generate a large amount of mana and quickly close out games with Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. Overall, the deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn.

The deck focuses on aggressive creatures like Phelia and Phlage to quickly defeat opponents. Cards like Solitude and Prismatic Ending are included for removal and disruption. Arena of Glory helps to buff creatures, while Consign to Memory can be used for card advantage. Ephemerate can protect key creatures and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker can generate additional value. The deck also includes some control elements like Spell Snare and March of Otherworldly Light to help manage the opponent's board. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of speed and disruption.

The deck focuses on utilizing lands that enter the battlefield with powerful effects, such as Amulet of Vigor and Crumbling Vestige, to ramp up mana quickly and play big threats like Primeval Titan and Scapeshift early in the game. This allows the player to search for specific lands with Urza's Saga and Tolaria West, setting up a combo that can quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes utility lands like Hanweir Battlements and Mirrorpool to provide additional value and options in different situations.

This deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays, supported by spells that deal direct damage and provide utility. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of efficient creatures like Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer and powerful enchantments like Ocelot Pride and Arena of Glory. The deck also includes removal spells like Galvanic Discharge and Goblin Bombardment to control the board and protect your creatures. Ajani, Nacatl Pariah serves as a potent finisher, while cards like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Voice of Victory provide additional firepower to close out games quickly.
